body: @owncloud-bot retest this please
sounds all cool. maybe you have a note on how upgrade works?

if an old file cache table is present it will translate the entries from the old table to the new one.
this is mainly done to preserve file ids for sharing
how does it scale on laaaarge setups (some tb of files)?
it will take some more time naturally, but it should scale without problems

@icewind1991 we've already had people complain about enormously long (severl hours) update time when they switched to 4.5, iirc it was because the oc_properties needed to be updated. i can imagine it is a more complex act here than a 1:1 substitution? i'd really love to have this sorted out.
@dragotin can you please fire your csync test suite agains this branch? thx

thanks a lot @icewind1991 for that. i hope this solves most of the problems that we currently have. before merging we should have the sharing working, a successful test from @dragotin with csync, a review from @schiesbn and @blizzz who know a lot of the corner-cases that users have. we also need an overview why this is faster for big installations than the old filecache and a brief architecture overview. @icewind1991 can you help with that? 
after merging we should work on some tutorials for developers how to use that.
thanks a lot :-)

i'll fire up the litmus test suite to ensure the webdav integration is still working
http://www.webdav.org/neon/litmus/

on 05.12.2012 15:03, thomas mã¼ller wrote:
> i'll fire up the litmus test suite to ensure the webdav integration is still working
> http://www.webdav.org/neon/litmus/
thanks, that would be a good thing.

klaas
@karlitschek sharing is done, i'll try pushing tonight. i'm having trouble testing because something's going wrong on my machine with this branch.

database migration and clean setup are broken in this branch: ``` [wed dec 05 23:00:38 2012] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] db error: db error: "sqlstate[hy000]: general error: 1 no such table: oc_fscache"
offending command was: select * from "oc_fscache" order by "id" asc
, referer: http://localhost/owncloud-phpstorm/?xdebug_session_start=18540 [wed dec 05 23:00:41 2012] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] db error: db error: "sqlstate[hy000]: general error: 1 no such table: oc_fscache"
offending command was: select * from "oc_fscache" order by "id" asc
, referer: http://localhost/owncloud-phpstorm/ [wed dec 05 23:00:41 2012] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] db error: db error: "sqlstate[hy000]: general error: 1 no such table: oc_fscache"
offending command was: select * from "oc_fscache" order by "id" asc
, referer: http://localhost/owncloud-phpstorm/
@deepdiver1975 are you using the filesystem branch for apps as well?
@deepdiver1975 on which line is that error thrown?

failing within call to \oc_db::prepare
https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/filesystem/lib/files/cache/upgrade.php#l18

ok, in my test prepare ran fine even with the table missing, i'll add a catch around it tomorrow.

the table missing is normal when doing a clean installation
@deepdiver1975 should be fixed
@icewind1991 ^
right, that behavior should probably be changed
@deepdiver1975 can you check if the problem is fixed with https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/762

better - but there are still some queries to fscache left in the code:
apps/files_sharing/public.php l53
apps/files_sharing/lib/share/folder.php l57
core/lib/public/share.php l34 & l71

one of these occurrences cause error on loading settings/personal.

we should try to avoid these direct sql queries within the sharing code to decouple the code more.
@mtgap can you have a look at those queries in sharing
@blizzz @schiesbn @dragotin do you had time for a real review and test? i think this is needed before a merge.
@karlitschek not yet, will try to do this today or tomorrow

i spent  a bit time reading through the code of cache, scanner and updater. i like the code. 

here are some comments:
* please normalize the storage column by creating another table 'storages' and reference an storage-id in the filecache table. that way you could cache the entire storages table in a static var in the modules and have a faster index on the storageid column in the filecache table. you really should do that.
* two directory entries in the table have a size of 0. that smells. is that correct? both are <username>/files
* method checkupdate in watcher.php checks in the database if the entry is a directory or not. does that still work if a file named foo was removed and a directory called foo is created instead, ie. through webdav?
* sorting: in getfoldercontents a order by name statement is used. i am not sure if that is sufficiient. maybe you should add another parameter "sortorder" to getfoldercontents which allows more sophisticated setting of sort orders, ie. sorting by size, mime type, also name. if its doable, the database should sort obviously, but for example for file names that is tricky anyway because of localization. 
* i have another feature request here: can we add a file id to the table that does never change during life time of a file, also not if it is renamed? that would be the first step to detect renames on server side, which is important for syncing.

i saw a couple of opportunities to save database selects again, but i think we can fix that later. what i haven't seen or understood is how the new cache is "embedded" in the whole system, for example in the sense of update notifications, sharing and stuff. it would be really good to get some basic documentation about that.

so far for the moment, i hope that makes sense for you. i can do more if it helps.

when i have the browser open in a file view, i see a get to index.php/apps/files/ajax/scan.php?force=false&dir=&requesttoken=3cf5367e3da4f1d5eb26 every three seconds.

it seems to check if directories exist that are still not scanned and starts them. this call is putting a high load on the server, i don't think we can ever go into production that way. and why is that needed? it will never result in 100% correct cache but introduce corner cases that are hard to debug, if we do not verify correctness whenever we need to access data from the cache. 

please explain how that is supposed to work.
